chargeHist.descr: Hit and Run-Involve Great Bodily Harm

result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert Perry Moore was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Reckless Driving-Cause Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Penalty-Reckless Driving, etc.], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.62(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes:
Credit for 11 days time served.
If revoked, defendant may have release for medical and treatment appointments.

Upon successful completion of all conditions of probation, the Court will allow the defendant's term of probation to be terminated after six months. Early termination to be approved at the discretion of the agent.

miscConds.notes:
Pay restitution in the amount of $1,000.00. $500.00 to be paid to Julie S-W. $500.00 to be paid to Karen K.
Defendant posted $2,000.00 cash bail. $1,000.00 of the bail on deposit to be applied towards the restitution amounts. The remaining $1,000.00 cash bail on deposit to be returned to the poster.

Maintain absolute sobriety. 
No driving without a valid license.

Pay $300.00 fine. Pay DNA surcharge. Pay all costs, fees, surcharges, fines, and restitution during period of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Defendant to enter into a payment plan with the agent.

timeConds.notes: At Project Return. Defendant to provide proof of completion to agent.

Associated with Charge #1
Justice Point Report received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Plea hearing proceeded. State placed negotiations on the record. Court finds the State has complied with the victim rights legislation.
Defendant sworn in.

As to COUNT 1 as AMENDED-
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.

Defendant Robert Perry Moore in court with attorney Marcella De Peters.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for plea and sentencing hearing. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. State filed an Amended Information. Defendant charged as follows:

COUNT 1- Reckless Driving (Causing Injury), contrary to sec. 346.62(3), 346.65(3) Wis. Stats., a Misdemeanor. 

Defense counsel acknowledged receipt of the amended information and waived reading.
Letter on behalf of the defendant received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Robert Perry Moore in court with attorney Marcella De Peters.  Defendant Robert Perry Moore in custody.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for final pretrial. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter and request a plea and sentencing date. Case remains scheduled for jury trial on 10/05/15. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Proposed verdict forms received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
State's Proposed Jury Instructions with attached substantive instructions received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
State's Witness List received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
State's Motion in Limine received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Justice Point report received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Three (3) Victim Impact Statements with attached restitution information received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Bench warrant cleared by Milwaukee County Sheriff on 9/10/15. Defendant was taken into custody following the court hearing on 9/09/15. Court will address bail on the next court date of 9/15/15. Deputy Court Clerk ccp. Bench warrant in file.

Clerk advised by the State and defense counsel they are unavailable for the bail hearing date scheduled yesterday. Per the Court, the bail hearing will be conducted on the next court date. Parties notified. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

NO FILE IN COURT. No appearances made by the parties. Case called on the record at the Court's request to address the Justice Point violation. Court ordered a bench warrant be issued pursuant to 968.09 and due to the defendant's non-compliance with Justice Point. COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT. Court deferred ruling on forfeiture of bail. Case remains scheduled for final pretrial on 9/15/15 and for jury trial on 10/05/15. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for September 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Discussion regarding the conditions of bail ordered in this case. Court ordered the defendant be probihited from driving as an additional condition of bail. All other conditions of bail remain the same.

Defendant Robert Perry Moore in court with attorney Marcella De Peters.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for plea hearing. Parties have not reached a resolution in this matter and defense requests final pretrial and jury trial dates. Court granted defense request. Discussion regarding Justice Point reports and defendant's non appearance at the last court date. Court withdrew the previously stayed bench warrant. Parties to file motions by 8/24/15. Any motions requiring testimony will be heard on the final pretrial date. Parties to file witness lists, jury instructions, and motions in limine by the final pretrial date. State to file proposed verdict forms and substantive jury instructions by the final pretrial date. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Justice Point Report received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Milwaukee County Pretrial Services Violation Report received and filed.

Defendant Robert Perry Moore not in court.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Marcella De Peters informed the Clerk earlier in the day that the defendant is currently in the hospital.  The Court stayed a bench warrant until August 3, 2015.  Parties were advised that as of August 1, 2015, this calendar will be transferred to the Honorable Stephanie G Rothstein, Brach #25 in Room G55 of the Criminal Justice Facility.

Defendant Robert Perry Moore in court with attorney Marcella De Peters.  Francesco Mineo appeared by telephone for the State of Wisconsin.  Also present in court:  WCS caseworker, Ms. Hannah Stout.  Entry made without file.  This case was set over from Intake Court to address defendant's Justice Point violations.  Statements made by the State, defense counsel and Ms. Stout.  Arguments heard as to bail.  Court denied State's requeste to increase bail at this time and ordered defendant to continue to work with Justice Point.  Defendant admonished by the Court.  Case remains calendared before Branch 20 on 7/16/15 at 1:30 p.m.  All terms of bail continue.

Defendant Robert Perry Moore in court with attorney Marcella De Peters.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT THE COURT FILE.  Present in court is Justice Point/WCS Case Worker Hannah Staudt.  Case in court due to violation.  Arguments heard as to bail.  Court admonishes Defendant.  No action taken at this time./Court amends cash bail.  Case remains calendared for Status Conference on July 9, 2015 in Branch 20.  Status conference scheduled for July 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Scheduling conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in settlement negotiations. 
Defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter.

TOT JUSTICE POINT. SAME TERMS/CONDITIONS

Defendant Robert Perry Moore in court with attorney Marcella De Peters.  Tyrone St. Junior for Francisco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court on walk-in basis to address JusticePoint violation; report received and filed.  The Court reviews report.  Statements made by the state and defense.  The Court modifies (increases) bail to $2,000 CASH WITH SAME TERMS.  Defendant taken into custody.  Case remains set for Scheduling Conference on 6-30-15 at 8:30 a.m. before Branch 20.
Amended Pretrial Release Conditions Order, signed and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defense request to remove GPS monitoring heard.  State did not object.  Court granted defense request and ordered GPS monitoring be removed, however, all other terms and conditions remain, including Justice Point monitoring.

Defendant Robert Perry Moore in court with attorney Marcella De Peters.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties request another scheduling date.  Court granted joint request and ordered case continued before Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 30, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Court reviewed JusticePoint report with the parties.

  Scheduling conference scheduled for 06-17-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Robert Perry Moore in court with attorney Marcella De Peters.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 20.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.

Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.

Oral No Contact Order with: Any Victim listed within the criminal complaint.

Defendant Robert Perry Moore in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin.  Defendant Robert Perry Moore in custody.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Robert Perry Moore not in court.  Hanna Ritchie Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identified, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.
